---
title: HTML

---


# HTML - Hype Text Markup Language

* HTML - gives the structure
* CSS - designs/styling
* Java - functionality

Has opening and closing tag - close tag "/"
```
<!DOCTYPE html> #uses the latest html
<html> #opening tag
    <body> # content
        <h1>Hello World</h1> #visible content in body - heading h1, h2, h3 like that
    </body>
</html>
```
## Commenting
```
<!--your comment goes here-->
```

Indentation error is not there in HTML but can help in readablity of the code.

## Adding Image
Image element does not have a closing tag. Mention the behavious of the element by mentioning in the opening tag.

Opening tag has its own attribute and the value like given below. 

alt attribute appears when image fails to load
```
<image src=data:image/jpeg;base64,
alt = " What is Bravery?">
```
## Adding Links
```
<a href="url"></a>

# adding links b/w the para - "Here" is a text with Hyperlink
<p>Click<a href="url">Here</a></p>

# opening the link in new tab
<p>Click<a href="url" targe="_blank">Here</a></p>

#creating the image as link
<a href="url" target="_blank"><img src="imgURL"></a>
```
## Lists
There are ordered and unordered lists.
```
<ul>
    <li>bullets</li>
</ul>

<ol>
    <li>numberings</li>
</ol>
```
## Fonts
```
<strong>bold</strong>
<em>italics</em>
<small>small</small>
```
## Form
```
# text box form
<form action="/photo">
    <input type="text" placeholder="type here">
    <!--adding mandatory to fill want to submit-->
    <input type="text" placeholder="type here" required>
    <button type="submit">Submit</button>
</form>

#MCQ form - selects both the option
<form>
    <input type="radio">Option 1
    <input type="radio">Option 2
    <button type="submit">Submit</button>
</form>

#MCQ form - selects any one option -added id for css
<form>
    <label for="opt1">
        <id="opt1" input type="radio" name="one-only">Option 1
    </label>
    <label for="opt2">
        <id="opt2" input type="radio" name="one-only">Option 2
    </label>
</form>

#MCQ - checkboxes - selects everthing or none - comes with first option sected
<form>
    <label for="opt1">
        <id="opt1" input type="checkboxes" name="one-only" checked>Option 1
    </label>
    <label for="opt2">
        <id="opt2" input type="checkboxes" name="one-only">Option 2
    </label>
</form>
```
## Head and Title
```
<head>
    <title>myWesbsite</title>
</head>
```
## Footer
```
<footer>
    All ends here
</footer>
